poem:
**The Secret's Chemistry**

In Maria's blood, the alchemy of time,  
little vials of living longer,  
while wisdom dances unhindered in her mind,  
she shuns the shadows of decline.  
Numbers become weights we refuse;  
but her heart beats to the rhythm  
of centuries,  
holding life like a well-tuned  
and timeless  
instrument.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Supercentenarian gives scientists insight on secrets of healthy old age The nonagenarian actor Dame Joan Collins may have been on to something when she declared “age is just a number”. The deepest dive yet into the biology of a supercentenarian has revealed that even extreme old age can be reached without the brain necessarily faltering or the usual illnesses mounting up. Doctors in Spain conducted a comprehensive suite of tests on Maria Branyas Morera, who". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
